intro: Malache maxonii, commonly known as the Maxon's malache, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and related plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Malache maxonii is considered a rare and endangered species.
